intro: Sida morifolia, commonly known as the velvetleaf or slender sida, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas and is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and small, pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, and it is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings. Sida morifolia has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes, including treating skin conditions and digestive issues.
